review_blob: AROMA: roasty, toast, nutmeg, cinnamon. APPEARANCE: Golden brown, hazy, minimal tan head. TASTE: Medium bitterness, PALATE: Medium body, has a "bite" to it, thin texture, fizzy, bitter / nutty finish. OVERALL: A nice beer for wintertime. Interesting spices of nutmeg and cinnamon with a nutty aftertaste. Bite and fizziness typical of Great Lakes.Not bad. Be sure to buy early in the season--it can be difficult to find in early December.

Very sweet, light body and fizzy almost like soda pop, long fruity finish, very fragrant aroma of raspberries, little-to-no beer taste--all raspberries here. Nice red color with pink head. Low alcohol, high "drinkability." Very simple, yet tasty and refreshing. Worth having again.
